intro: Glandonia prancei, commonly known as the Prance's glandonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
